natmanager 0.1.0
  • Reference

    natmanager

    The goal of natmanager is to handle the installation of all packages inside the natverse repository.

    Prerequisite

    To install this package you need to have R and R-studio installed. The detailed instructions per operating system are given below.

    Linux

    1. Install r, in terminal type below:
    sudo apt-get install libopenblas-base r-base
    1. Install R-studio, in terminal type below:
    sudo apt-get install gdebi
cd ~/Downloads
wget https://download1.rstudio.org/rstudio-xenial-1.1.419-amd64.deb
sudo gdebi rstudio-xenial-1.1.419-amd64.deb
    1. Start R-studio, in terminal type below:
    rstudio

    Mac OS X

    1. Install r from here: r-installation

    2. Install R-studio, from here: R-studio-installation

    3. Start R-studio from Launchpad

    Windows

    1. Install r from here: r-installation

    2. Install R-studio, for Windows from here: R-studio-installation

    3. Start R-studio from Programs menu

    Installation

    You can install the released version of natmanager from CRAN with:

    install.packages("natmanager")

    Or the development version from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("natverse/natmanager")

    Usage

    Once installed, you can load/attach the package as follows:

    library('natmanager')

    Further, you can install packages inside the natverse repository as follows:

    install('natverse')

    You can also look at all the repos available in the natverse organization as follows:

    list_repo()

    FAQs

    1. On using install fuction from the package to install a natverse repository, I’m getting an error like below:
    Error: (converted from warning) package 'xx' was built under R version y.y.y
Execution halted
ERROR: lazy loading failed for package 'xx'

    This occurs mainly when your r version is lower than what the package was built for (mainly CRAN packages are built with latest version). If you are sure that it is a problem due to version, then you use like below and retry the install function.

    Sys.setenv("R_REMOTES_NO_ERRORS_FROM_WARNINGS"=TRUE)

    See further discussion here
